snippet: A slow-moving investigation into the killing, hampered by troubled cooperation between Italian and Egyptian police, has prompted Italian accusations of an Egyptian cover-up.
abstract: Italian Foreign Min Paolo Gentiloni says his government wil take 'immediate and proportional' action against Egypt if it fails to deliver answers in death of Italian student Giulio Regeni in February; sluggish investigation hampered by political concerns has drawn accusations of Egyptian cover-up.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and NOUR YOUSSEF
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Catania, Italy, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: A slow-moving investigation into the killing, hampered by troubled cooperation between Italian and Egyptian police, has prompted Italian accusations of an Egyptian cover-up.

headline.main: Italian Official Warns Egypt Over Inquiry Into Student’s Death
headline.print_headline: Italian Official Warns Egypt Over Inquiry Into Student’s Death
